commit_message:
This test searches for seldom used names in python source code
If name is used less than two times - error is reported

Change-Id: I861b40ce69f9d782f1343b6cf80d44d2f5a6b2bd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/21/241621/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
import ast import __builtin__ import os from tests.unit import test class FuncNameUsageChecker(ast.NodeVisitor): """Recursively visit an AST looking for python names used in source code Module definition and every found class definition or function definition add new empty dictionary in ValueNamesDictList and AssgnTargetNamesDictList All name occurrences as assign target are counted in AssgnTargetNamesDictList All other name occurrences are added to top dictionary in ValueNamesDictList If value for 'name' key in ValueNamesDictList is less than 2 and there is no occurrences of this name in global list or targets list - error is added to errors list If value for 'name' key in AssgnTargetNamesDictList is less than 2 - error is added to errors list """ def __init__(self): self.errors = [] # This list is used for error storage self.MyFullAttrib = '' # This variable is used for complete set of attributes, separated with dot self.ValueNamesDictList = [] # This is dictonaries list for names of right side of assign stmt or all other names self.AssgnTargetNamesDictList = [] # This is dictonaries list for names for left side of assign stmt only self.ModuleGlobalNamesDict = {} # change to dict, add check for global variables self.ModulesDict = {} # Used for imported module names storage self.BuiltInAndGlobalList = [] # Used to store all global names from modules and built-ins self.LineNumsForTargets = {} # Used to store line numbers for targets self.LineNumsForNames = {} # Used to store line numbers for over names self.LastUsedLineNum = 1 # Used to store line number nearest for name if object in AST # doesn't have lineno property def add_item_to_dict_list(self, my_dict_list, my_item): """ Add item to top dictionary in List or increase dictionary number for key my_item """ if my_item in my_dict_list[-1]: my_dict_list[-1][my_item] += 1 else: my_dict_list[-1][my_item] = 1 def increase_count_only_if_exist_in_dict(self, my_dict_list, my_item): """ Function increase number for existing key in dictionaries in list only returns True if insertion is occured """ for MyListItem in reversed(my_dict_list): # running dictionaries in list from top to buttom if my_item in MyListItem: MyListItem[my_item] += 1 # we found Item, increase dict value return True return False def check_for_errors(self): """ For each function found in module perform check """ for NamesDictItem in self.ValueNamesDictList[-1].keys(): if NamesDictItem in self.BuiltInAndGlobalList or \ self.ValueNamesDictList[-1][NamesDictItem] > 1: self.increase_count_only_if_exist_in_dict(self.AssgnTargetNamesDictList, NamesDictItem) continue if self.ValueNamesDictList[-1][NamesDictItem] == 1 \ and self.increase_count_only_if_exist_in_dict(self.AssgnTargetNamesDictList, NamesDictItem): # name exists as target in top level namespace continue self.errors.append({ "lineno": self.LineNumsForNames[NamesDictItem], "messages": 'Name "' + NamesDictItem + '" is used only one time' }) for NamesDictItem in self.AssgnTargetNamesDictList[-1].keys(): if NamesDictItem in self.BuiltInAndGlobalList: continue if self.AssgnTargetNamesDictList[-1][NamesDictItem] < 2: self.errors.append({ "lineno": self.LineNumsForTargets[NamesDictItem], "messages": 'Assign target name "' + NamesDictItem + '" is used only one time' }) def visit_Module(self, node): # module namespace validation should been implemented self.ValueNamesDictList.append({}) self.AssgnTargetNamesDictList.append({}) code = compile(node, "<ast>", "exec") try: exec (code, self.ModulesDict) except Exception: pass for MyModuleName in self.ModulesDict: self.BuiltInAndGlobalList.append(MyModuleName) self.BuiltInAndGlobalList += dir(MyModuleName) self.BuiltInAndGlobalList += dir(__builtin__) self.generic_visit(node) self.ValueNamesDictList.pop() self.AssgnTargetNamesDictList.pop() def visit_ClassDef(self, node): # class namespace validation should been implemented self.LastUsedLineNum = node.lineno if node.name in self.BuiltInAndGlobalList: # it is locally defined class on top level in module. we will count it as well, # removing from BuiltInAndGlobalList self.BuiltInAndGlobalList.remove(node.name) if node.name in self.ModuleGlobalNamesDict: self.ModuleGlobalNamesDict[node.name] += 1 else: self.ModuleGlobalNamesDict[node.name] = 1 self.AssgnTargetNamesDictList.append({}) self.ValueNamesDictList.append({}) self.generic_visit(node) self.AssgnTargetNamesDictList.pop() self.ValueNamesDictList.pop() def visit_FunctionDef(self, node): self.LastUsedLineNum = node.lineno if node.name in self.BuiltInAndGlobalList: # it is locally defined function on top level in module. we will count it as well self.BuiltInAndGlobalList.remove(node.name) if node.name in self.ModuleGlobalNamesDict: self.ModuleGlobalNamesDict[node.name] += 1 else: self.ModuleGlobalNamesDict[node.name] = 1 self.AssgnTargetNamesDictList.append({}) self.ValueNamesDictList.append({}) self.generic_visit(node) self.check_for_errors() self.AssgnTargetNamesDictList.pop() self.ValueNamesDictList.pop() def visit_arguments(self, node): if node.kwarg != None: self.add_item_to_dict_list(self.ValueNamesDictList, node.kwarg) self.LineNumsForNames[node.kwarg] = self.LastUsedLineNum if node.vararg != None: self.add_item_to_dict_list(self.ValueNamesDictList, node.vararg) self.LineNumsForNames[node.vararg] = self.LastUsedLineNum self.generic_visit(node) def visit_Assign(self, node): for MyNode in node.targets: self.MyFullAttrib = '' for MyNode1 in ast.walk(MyNode): if isinstance(MyNode1, ast.Attribute): if self.MyFullAttrib != '': self.MyFullAttrib = MyNode1.attr + '.' + self.MyFullAttrib else: self.MyFullAttrib = MyNode1.attr if isinstance(MyNode1, ast.Name): if MyNode.col_offset > 0: # item is not Global Var if self.MyFullAttrib == '': # Name doesn't have attributes - new assign self.add_item_to_dict_list(self.AssgnTargetNamesDictList, MyNode1.id) self.LineNumsForTargets[MyNode1.id] = MyNode1.lineno self.LastUsedLineNum = MyNode1.lineno else: # name has attributes - we assign object properties if self.increase_count_only_if_exist_in_dict( self.AssgnTargetNamesDictList, MyNode1.id ): self.MyFullAttrib = '' self.LineNumsForTargets[MyNode1.id] = MyNode1.lineno self.LastUsedLineNum = MyNode1.lineno else: if MyNode1.id in self.ModuleGlobalNamesDict: self.ModuleGlobalNamesDict[MyNode1.id] += 1 else: self.ModuleGlobalNamesDict[MyNode1.id] = 1 for MyNode in ast.walk(node.value): if isinstance(MyNode, ast.Name): self.add_item_to_dict_list(self.ValueNamesDictList, MyNode.id) self.LineNumsForNames[MyNode.id] = MyNode.lineno self.LastUsedLineNum = MyNode.lineno def visit_Name(self, node): if node.id in self.ModuleGlobalNamesDict: # It is reference to global module name - increase particular counter self.ModuleGlobalNamesDict[node.id] += 1 else: # Ordinary Names self.add_item_to_dict_list(self.ValueNamesDictList, node.id) self.LineNumsForNames[node.id] = node.lineno self.LastUsedLineNum = node.lineno class NameUsageCheckerTestCase(test.TestCase): """ Class NameUsageCheckerTestCase is used to walk through files in tests folder and start check for each file "test_*" or *.py found it is also fills errors list to pass it up into test environment it has only one method - test_name_usage_checker """ tests_path = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__)) def test_name_usage_checker(self): """ test_name_usage_checker method of class NameUsageCheckerTestCase is used to walk through files in tests folder and start check for each file "test_*" or *.py found it is also fills errors list to pass it up into test environment """ errors = [] for dirname, dirnames, filenames in os.walk(self.tests_path): for filename in filenames: if (not filename.startswith("test_") or not filename.endswith(".py")): continue filename = os.path.relpath(os.path.join(dirname, filename)) with open(filename, "rb") as fh: tree = ast.parse(fh.read(), filename) visitor = FuncNameUsageChecker() visitor.visit(tree) errors.extend( dict(filename=filename, **error) for error in visitor.errors) if errors: print(FuncNameUsageChecker.__doc__) print( "

" "The following errors were found during the described check:") for error in errors: print("

" "Errors at file %(filename)s line %(lineno)d:

" "%(message)s" % { "message": "
" + error["messages"], "filename": error["filename"], "lineno": error["lineno"]}) self.assertEqual([], errors)

rally/benchmark/scenarios/neutron/utils.py

commit_message:
Adds Neutron floatingip tests

This submission adds three methods to
1) create_floatingip
2) list_floatingip
3) delete_floatingip

Also adds Neutron floatingip scenarios to
floatingips.py

Added configuration files for floatingip operations
1) create-and-list-floatingips.json
2) create-and-list-floatingips.yaml
3) create-and-delete-floatingips.json
4) create-and-delete-floatingips.yaml

Added unittests to test_utils.py and test_network.py

Change-Id: Ib3cdb39db9254f62142f27325ef4ca81cdd47bf0

commit_message:
Add member role to created users (keystone V2 API)

When creating users using keystone API V2 the users
don't have the member role. This can be a problem
on some deployments.

This commit adds to the user the first "member" role
it finds like in the KeystoneV3Wrapper (any role that
contains "member" will match).

Change-Id: I69361811fe3b86cb7d269daa2715bb3aaec4d2cf
Closes-Bug: #1492177

commit_message:
Add Neutron create_and_list_secgroups scenario

Implement create_and_list_secgroups scenario for neutron.
Adds supporting methods '_create_security_group'
and '_list_security_group' to
"rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/neutron/utils.py".

Change-Id: Ia34f786758a2fbc50576aabfddc3caea17fc006f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/89/216589/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch(NEUTRON_UTILS + "NeutronScenario._generate_random_name") def test_create_security_group(self, mock__generate_random_name): scenario = utils.NeutronScenario() security_group = mock.Mock() mock__generate_random_name.return_value = "random_name" self.clients("neutron").create_security_group.return_value = ( security_group) # Default options result_security_group = scenario._create_security_group({}) self.clients("neutron").create_security_group.assert_called_once_with( {"security_group": {"name": "random_name"}}) self.assertEqual(result_security_group, security_group) self._test_atomic_action_timer(scenario.atomic_actions(), "neutron.create_security_group") def test_list_security_groups(self): scenario = utils.NeutronScenario() security_groups_list = [] security_groups_dict = {"security_groups": security_groups_list} self.clients("neutron").list_security_groups.return_value = ( security_groups_dict) return_security_groups_list = scenario._list_security_groups() self.assertEqual(security_groups_list, return_security_groups_list) self._test_atomic_action_timer(scenario.atomic_actions(), "neutron.list_security_groups")

commit_message:
[WIP] AtomicAction contexts for neutron scenarios

AtomicAction context added for optimization of plot function performance
when multiple neutron items created/updated/deleted.

Change-Id: Idf19e876d2525e099d7ba4cb76d6816d44def08c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/17/192517/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: key = "neutron.update_%s_subnets" % subnets_per_network with base.AtomicAction(self, key): for subnet in subnets: self._update_subnet(subnet, subnet_update_args) key = "neutron.delete_%s_subnets" % subnets_per_network with base.AtomicAction(self, key): for subnet in subnets: self._delete_subnet(subnet) key = "neutron.create_%s_routers" % subnets_per_network with base.AtomicAction(self, key): for subnet in subnets: router = self._create_router(router_create_args or {}) self.clients("neutron").add_interface_router( router["router"]["id"], {"subnet_id": subnet["subnet"]["id"]}) key = "neutron.update_%s_routers" % subnets_per_network with base.AtomicAction(self, key): for subnet in subnets: router = self._create_router(router_create_args or {}) self.clients("neutron").add_interface_router( router["router"]["id"], {"subnet_id": subnet["subnet"]["id"]}) self._update_router(router, router_update_args) key = "neutron.create_%s_routers" % subnets_per_network with base.AtomicAction(self, key): routers = [] for subnet in subnets: router = self._create_router(router_create_args or {}) self.clients("neutron").add_interface_router( router["router"]["id"], {"subnet_id": subnet["subnet"]["id"]}) routers.append(router) key = "neutron.delete_%s_routers" % subnets_per_network with base.AtomicAction(self, key): for e in range(subnets_per_network): router = routers[e] subnet = subnets[e] self.clients("neutron").remove_interface_router( router["router"]["id"], {"subnet_id": subnet["subnet"]["id"]}) self._delete_router(router) key = "neutron.create_%s_ports" % ports_per_network with base.AtomicAction(self, key): for i in range(ports_per_network): self._create_port(network, port_create_args or {})
deleted_lines: for subnet in subnets: self._update_subnet(subnet, subnet_update_args) for subnet in subnets: self._delete_subnet(subnet) for subnet in subnets: router = self._create_router(router_create_args or {}) self.clients("neutron").add_interface_router( router["router"]["id"], {"subnet_id": subnet["subnet"]["id"]}) for subnet in subnets: router = self._create_router(router_create_args or {}) self.clients("neutron").add_interface_router( router["router"]["id"], {"subnet_id": subnet["subnet"]["id"]}) self._update_router(router, router_update_args) routers = [] for subnet in subnets: router = self._create_router(router_create_args or {}) self.clients("neutron").add_interface_router( router["router"]["id"], {"subnet_id": subnet["subnet"]["id"]}) routers.append(router) for e in range(subnets_per_network): router = routers[e] subnet = subnets[e] self.clients("neutron").remove_interface_router( router["router"]["id"], {"subnet_id": subnet["subnet"]["id"]}) self._delete_router(router) for i in range(ports_per_network): self._create_port(network, port_create_args or {})

commit_message:
Add Dockerfile for CentOS-based Rally image

Change-Id: I8fc7cc213427c1f84e315eb0ce95d2a8d6c7131f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/91/180191/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: FROM centos COPY . /tmp/rally RUN yum install -y git wget bash-completion python-devel libffi-devel gmp-devel \ gcc libxml2-devel libxslt-devel openssl-devel postgresql-devel \ babel python-decorator python-jinja2 python-netaddr python-six \ PyYAML python-psycopg2 python-requests python27-python-sqlalchemy \ python-sphinx python-virtualenv pyOpenSSL python-lxml &&\ cd /tmp &&\ curl "https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py" -o "get-pip.py" &&\ python get-pip.py &&\ cd /tmp/rally &&\ ./install_rally.sh &&\ sed 's|#*connection *=.*|connection = sqlite:////home/rally/.rally.sqlite|' -i /etc/rally/rally.conf &&\ yum remove -y openssl-devel python-devel libxml2-devel libxslt-devel gcc && \ yum autoremove -y &&\ yum clean all &&\ mv doc /usr/share/doc/rally &&\ rm -rf /tmp/* &&\ useradd -u 65500 -m rally &&\ ln -s /usr/share/doc/rally /home/rally/rally-docs USER rally CMD bash --login ENV HOME /home/rally WORKDIR /home/rally

subject: Add name pattern filter for resource cleanup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-05 14:40:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/577eb3b4ddec088120e65fbe736647062d4c0f46', 'message': 'Add name pattern filter for resource cleanup

Rally cleanups all resources in tenants which are used by test. In order to
avoid to be deleted unintended resources, it would be better to delete only
resources created by Rally instead of deleting all resources in the tenants.
And also in the case of using pre-defined users and pre-defined tenants for
test, it would be better to keep existing resources, instead of deleting all
resources in those tenants.

Resources created by scenario have name prefix "rally_xxxxxx". This new
function checks name pattern and delete only matched resources.

Untested service resources are bypassed for this filtering.
 - Tested service: cinder, glance, keystone, neutron, nova

In the case of context cleanup, this filtering function is also called and
context resources are not deleted because the names don't match the filtering
patterns. Resources created by context should have another prefix, for example
"ctx_rally_xxxxxx".

Change-Id: I49f45f87473f5d8793db397d3bd403b85794eb4c
Implements: blueprint add-cleanup-option
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-10 16:20:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/1120c8af4f13002e318f88d46225fe25af72a34b', 'message': 'Add name pattern filter for resource cleanup

commit_message:
Add name pattern filter for resource cleanup

Rally cleanups all resources in tenants which are used by test. In order to
avoid to be deleted unintended resources, it would be better to delete only
resources created by Rally instead of deleting all resources in the tenants.
And also in the case of using pre-defined users and pre-defined tenants for
test, it would be better to keep existing resources, instead of deleting all
resources in those tenants.

Resources created by scenario have name prefix "rally_xxxxxx". This new
function checks name pattern and delete only matched resources.

Untested service resources are bypassed for this filtering.
 - Tested services: cinder, ceilometer, designate, glance, heat, keystone,
                    mistral, neutron, nova

In the case of context cleanup, this filtering function is also called and
context resources are deleted separately from scenario resources because the
resources have another prefix "ctx_rally_xxxxxx".

Change-Id: I49f45f87473f5d8793db397d3bd403b85794eb4c
Implements: blueprint add-cleanup-option

added_lines: import os import sys from rally.common.i18n import _ from rally.common import utils from rally import db from rally import objects from rally.openstack.common import cliutils as common_cliutils from rally import osclients class OpenStackInformation(): """Set of commands that help in extracting information about the cloud.""" def list_service(self, deployment=None) """Lists all services. :param deploymet: a UUID or name of the deployment """ headers = ['services', 'type', 'status']; table_rows = [] try: admin = db.deployment_get(deployment)['admin'] for endpoint_dict in [admin]: clients = osclients.Clients(objects.Endpoint(**endpoint_dict)) client = clients.verified_keystone() print("keystone endpoints are valid and following " "services are available:") for service in client.services.list(): data = [service.name, serivce.type, 'Available'] table_rows.append(utils.Struct(**dict(zip(headers, data)))) except exceptions.InvalidArgumentsException: data = ['keystone', 'identity', 'Error'] table_rows.append(utils.Struct(**dict(zip(headers, data)))) print(_("Authentication Issues: %s.") % sys.exc_info()[1] return(1) common_cliutils.print_list(table_rows, headers)

commit_message:
Update the VMTask class with a boot_ping method

with a default of using floating_ip
allocation.  Alternatively depending on the
tenant network type, and if the rally host
has direct access to VLAN on which VMs are
being generated, private_network IP may
be suitable for ping testing.

The new boot_ping method copied from boot_runcommand_delete
has some minor differences.  Specifically, we are not running
a script, and as such the comments are updated to be clear
on the differences.  Furthermore, since we're using
@base.atomic_action_timer("vm.wait_for_ping")
in .../vm/utils.py to track times and success rate, we
return a simple json as expected.  Nothing further is required.

Fix minor coding issues, and add missing files
to pass tests.

Change-Id: Ic2713555ed7de4a18dac22965c901c313e5e97eb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/46/150546/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @types.set(image=types.ImageResourceType, flavor=types.FlavorResourceType) @validation.image_valid_on_flavor("flavor", "image") @validation.number("port", minval=1, maxval=65535, nullable=True, integer_only=True) @validation.external_network_exists("floating_network", "use_floatingip") @validation.required_services(consts.Service.NOVA, consts.Service.CINDER) @validation.required_openstack(users=True) @base.scenario(context={"cleanup": ["nova", "cinder"], "keypair": {}, "allow_ssh": {}}) def boot_ping(self, image, flavor, fixed_network="private", floating_network="public", ip_version=4, port=22, use_floatingip=True, **kwargs): """Boot server, run a script that outputs JSON, delete server. :param fixed_network: Network where instance is part of :param floating_network: External network used to get floating ip from :param ip_version: Version of ip protocol to use for connection :param port: Port to use for SSH connection :param use_floatingip: Whether to associate a floating ip for connection :returns: Dictionary containing two keys, data and errors. Data is JSON data output by the script. Errors is raw data from the script's standard error stream. """ fip = server = None net_wrap = network_wrapper.wrap(self.clients) internal_network = server.networks.keys()[0] fixed_ip = server.addresses[internal_network][0]["addr"] try: server = self._boot_server( self._generate_random_name("rally_novaserver_"), image, flavor, key_name='rally_ssh_key', **kwargs) self.check_network(server, fixed_network) if use_floatingip: fip = net_wrap.create_floating_ip(ext_network=floating_network, int_network=internal_network, tenant_id=server.tenant_id, fixed_ip=fixed_ip) self._associate_floating_ip(server, fip["ip"], fixed_address=fixed_ip) server_ip = fip["ip"] else: server_ip = fixed_ip self.wait_for_ping(server_ip) out = json.loads("{ \"ping\": 1 }") err = "" finally: if use_floatingip: self._dissociate_floating_ip(server, fip["ip"]) return {"data": out, "errors": err}

commit_message:
Update the VMTask class with a boot_ping method

with a default of using floating_ip
allocation.  Alternatively depending on the
tenant network type, and if the rally host
has direct access to VLAN on which VMs are
being generated, private_network IP may
be suitable for ping testing.

Change-Id: I41e49d96c0650b1b5c28e752bd546246528f40d2

added_lines: @types.set(image=types.ImageResourceType, flavor=types.FlavorResourceType) @validation.image_valid_on_flavor("flavor", "image") @validation.number("port", minval=1, maxval=65535, nullable=True, integer_only=True) @validation.external_network_exists("floating_network", "use_floatingip") @validation.required_services(consts.Service.NOVA, consts.Service.CINDER) @validation.required_openstack(users=True) @base.scenario(context={"cleanup": ["nova", "cinder"], "keypair": {}, "allow_ssh": {}}) def boot_ping(self, image, flavor, fixed_network="private", floating_network="public", ip_version=4, port=22, use_floatingip=True, **kwargs): """Boot server, run a script that outputs JSON, delete server. :param fixed_network: Network where instance is part of :param floating_network: External network used to get floating ip from :param ip_version: Version of ip protocol to use for connection :param port: Port to use for SSH connection :param use_floatingip: Whether to associate a floating ip for connection :returns: Dictionary containing two keys, data and errors. Data is JSON data output by the script. Errors is raw data from the script's standard error stream. """ fip = server = None try: server = self._boot_server( self._generate_random_name("rally_novaserver_"), image, flavor, key_name='rally_ssh_key', **kwargs) self.check_network(server, fixed_network) fixed_ip = [ip for ip in server.addresses[fixed_network] if ip["version"] == ip_version][0]["addr"] if use_floatingip: fip = net_wrap.create_floating_ip(ext_network=floating_network, int_network=internal_network, tenant_id=server.tenant_id, fixed_ip=fixed_ip) self._associate_floating_ip(server, fip["ip"], fixed_address=fixed_ip) server_ip = fip["ip"] else: server_ip = fixed_ip self.wait_for_ping(server_ip) out = json.loads("{ \"ping\": 1 }") err = "" finally: if use_floatingip: self._dissociate_floating_ip(server, fip["ip"]) return {"data": out, "errors": err}

commit_message:
[atomic_actions]Add script to upgrade database

We have save new format of atomic format to rally
database, and will use new format to report and
output text.
This scripts migrates old format of atomic acitons to new format.

Change-Id: Ic8ddc33630b64c27963e98f1dfd9dfa0002be4b3

added_lines: for workloaddata in connection.execute(workloaddata_helper.select()): for result in workloaddata.chunk_data["raw"]: if isinstance(result["atomic_actions"], dict): new_atomic_actions = [] started_at = result["timestamp"] for action, duration in result["atomic_actions"].items(): finished_at = started_at + duration new_atomic_actions.append({"name": action, "started_at": started_at, "finished_at": finished_at, "children": []}) started_at = finished_at result["atomic_actions"] = new_atomic_actions print workloaddata.chunk_data workloaddata_helper.update().where( workloaddata_helper.c.id == workloaddata.id).values( chunk_data=workloaddata.chunk_data))
deleted_lines: with op.batch_alter_table("deployments") as batch_op: batch_op.add_column( sa.Column("new_credentials", sa_types.MutableJSONEncodedDict, default={})) for deployment in connection.execute(deployments_helper.select()): creds = {} for cred_type, cred_obj in deployment.credentials: creds.setdefault(cred_type, []) creds[cred_type].append(cred_obj) deployments_helper.update().where( deployments_helper.c.id == deployment.id).values( new_credentials=creds)) with op.batch_alter_table("deployments") as batch_op: batch_op.drop_column("credentials") batch_op.alter_column("new_credentials", new_column_name="credentials", existing_type=sa_types.MutableJSONEncodedDict, nullable=False)

commit_message:
Bind SAIO services on different loopback addresses

Currently all devices in the ring and all services in a SAIO
all bind to the same loopback address 127.0.0.1. But this
breaks servers_per_port if you want to do any testing on that.

This change binds each service to a different loopback address
and updates the rings (remakerings) accordingly.

To make sure rysncd binds correctly the bind address needed
to be changed to listen on all addresses (0.0.0.0).

Change-Id: I7e77434f275df1e2699de495d8b622b90157a9d7

subject: Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-16 08:03:52.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/e89115bdb07fed4564a8baec8b5adeabdb28396e', 'message': 'Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Changing Popen to .check_output because of 2 reasons:
1. check_output() will raise CalledProcessError if
the called process returns a non-zero return code.
2. For consistency with keystone [1] and cinder [2]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/457142
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433081

Change-Id: I514a2777593994c7c4e80ad4c7f9269ec746646b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Changing Popen to .check_output because of 2 reasons:
1. check_output() will raise CalledProcessError if
the called process returns a non-zero return code.
2. For consistency with keystone [1] and cinder [2]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/457142
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433081

Change-Id: I514a2777593994c7c4e80ad4c7f9269ec746646b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas refs/changes/84/474884/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: html_last_updated_fmt = subprocess.check_output(git_cmd).decode('utf-8')

commit_message:
Fix several TODOs in db layer

* calculate load duration for tasks and subtasks
* save pass_sla of task and subtasks
* 'start_time' column of workloads is designed to store timestamps which
  are floats in python(not datetime objects). Unfortunately, we cannot use
  float type of column due to limations of some db backends. To make the
  life easier, this patch adds new type which will convert timestamp(float
  value which is used in our code) and datetime(type of data which will be
  store in db). Also, this patch remove default value of the column, since
  start_time should represent the start of the load which we do not have
  in case of validation failure.

Change-Id: I737656d302061665a314d8435295c25791998044

commit_message:
Don't store attributes if resource not stored

If stack-show is called at an inopportune moment in convergence, we can
attempt to store the attributes of a resource that isn't actually in the
database.  This causes occasional gate failures due to an assert.

Closes-Bug: #1701569
Change-Id: I50de08ae6b40958781ef4223c82a5c195b0757bf

commit_message:
Prefer volumev3 and volumev2 endpoints over volume

Make cinderclient use volumev3 or volumev2 endpoints, before
falling back to the volume endpoint, otherwise Horizon is
trying to use the v1 API, and that doesn't work with the
"sort" parameter that we are using, resulting in an empty
volumes list.

Change-Id: Id03988d89000c4bc976090c68a41ee320b9d43f7
Closes-bug: #1700977

commit_message:
Add an add_output() method to Template

This helps with dynamically building templates, and is similar to the
add_resource method.

Change-Id: I51ce5c913438083d6d43eb6d8a8bf55cfa8ea3ee
Related-Bug: #1660831
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/94/476294/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def add_output(self, definition): if self.t.get(self.OUTPUTS) is None: self.t[self.OUTPUTS] = {} self.t[self.OUTPUTS][definition.name] = definition.render_hot()

commit_message:
Start NFS and SMB services on fedora platforms

after installing them in the devstack plugin.

Change-Id: Idddbcdf8750a041aa79943f9950c20c4d9d35502
Closes-Bug: #1670434
(cherry picked from commit af7ac539aa85192044b1d4d2921467a6d91d943b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/40/479040/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo systemctl enable smb.service sudo systemctl start smb.service sudo systemctl enable nfs-server.service sudo systemctl start nfs-server.service

Fix plugin not found exception

Add plugin not found exception, if we not get L3 plugin.

Change-Id: I5c77af0c4a1f018ef944ba608fc4bffc10427eab

Much like the themable selects and checkboxes, number spinners
should also be themable.

Standard number spinners are not very customizable.  We should use
existing buttons and fonts to add their functionality to allow a
richer experience if desired downstream.

An example of how to customize the spinner was placed in Material.
The example shows how to use flexbox to change layout type from
column to row, change icon order, and how to override the icons.

Change-Id: Ifd266cd515a903841e2d28e2f4731879116e3513
Closes-bug: #1598311

'}, {'number': 13, 'created': '2016-07-28 17:28:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/e7f0f8a32f87d0ba9c68f5ac30532021a8be449e', 'message': "Horizon Forms should allow themable number spinners

Much like the themable selects and checkboxes, number spinners
should also be themable.

Standard number spinners are not very customizable.  We should use
existing buttons and fonts to add their functionality to allow a
richer experience if desired downstream.

An example of how to customize the spinner was placed in Material.
The example shows how to use flexbox to change layout type from
column to row, change icon order, and how to override the icons.

'autocomplete' needs to be false on this new element, otherwise
the browser will retain and load the last value without actually
triggering any JavaScript events by which we can key on and update
the state of the spinner buttons.

Change-Id: Ifd266cd515a903841e2d28e2f4731879116e3513
Closes-bug: #1598311

commit_message:
Horizon Forms should allow themable number spinners

Much like the themable selects and checkboxes, number spinners
should also be themable.

Standard number spinners are not very customizable.  We should use
existing buttons and fonts to add their functionality to allow a
richer experience if desired downstream.

An example of how to customize the spinner was placed in Material.
The example shows how to use flexbox to change layout type from
column to row, change icon order, and how to override the icons.

'autocomplete' needs to be false on this new element, otherwise
the browser will retain and load the last value without actually
triggering any JavaScript events by which we can key on and update
the state of the spinner buttons.

Change-Id: Ifd266cd515a903841e2d28e2f4731879116e3513
Closes-bug: #1598311
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/36/337936/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .themable-spinner { display: flex; // Remove default spinner styles here // ********************************** input { text-align: right; -moz-appearance: textfield; } .themable-spinner input::-webkit-inner-spin-button, .themable-spinner input::-webkit-outer-spin-button { -webkit-appearance: none; margin: 0; /* Removes leftover margin */ } // ********************************** .input-group-btn-vertical { .btn { line-height: 1; margin-left: -1px; border-top-left-radius: 0; border-bottom-left-radius: 0; padding-top: 0; padding-bottom: 0; height: 100%; &.spinner-up { border-bottom-right-radius: 0; } &.spinner-down { border-top-right-radius: 0; } &-container { line-height: 1; flex: 0 1 50%; } } &-container { display: flex; flex-direction: column; height: 100%; } } }

commit_message:
Fix python development package name on RHEL

python-dev is not the correct package for RHEL systems and is instead
python-devel. It looks as thought this package is also installed in other places
for Ubuntu/Debian systems so this seems like logical to remove the duplicate
package resource.

Change-Id: Ifb6c439171ed6a65ba67cc6fe8076d2fa42da32d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-integration-test refs/changes/01/478201/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: libffi-devel python-devel python-setuptools),

commit_message:
Remove deprecated (and unused) 'sqlite_db' config option

When running pep8 tox (and other environments) there is a deprecation
warning:

"DeprecationWarning: Using the 'sqlite_db' argument is
deprecated: Config option sqlite_db is deprecated for removal,
please use option `connection`"

The `connection` option is already being used in the call, and
this patch removes the (unused) `sqllite_db` option.

Closes-Bug: #1618659 
Change-Id: I5d71cd063ec5c906c1a8c5556bf4b0171436635a
(cherry picked from commit c99635766085b972aa83741f37a2a2a66daf6363)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/46/466446/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: db_options.set_defaults(cfg.CONF, connection=_SQL_CONNECTION_DEFAULT, max_pool_size=10, max_overflow=20, pool_timeout=10)
deleted_lines: db_options.set_defaults(cfg.CONF, connection=_SQL_CONNECTION_DEFAULT, sqlite_db='', max_pool_size=10, max_overflow=20, pool_timeout=10)

Clean up the redundant code

In the file common/wsgi.py and common/config.py, the unused import
is still existed, This patch is to remove the redundant codes.

commit_message:
Fix some errors with the replace-keys role

The stat module requires a path argument.
We want to use the -D argument to ssh-add which means 'delete all
identities', not -d which means 'delete the default identities'.

Change-Id: I04dc8d409ec0d315a055fed2615acb400310c866
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-roles refs/changes/52/479452/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: stat: path: "{{ zuul_temp_ssh_key }}"

commit_message:
Fix the database user name for all roles

when create database user, it should use
database_user, not database_name.

Change-Id: I4dfa01d1a5a46c5c58f1fc47b0be71b186462764
Closes-Bug: #1698762

commit_message:
Added 'openstack image set --visibility'

This feature will allow image owners to share images across multiple
tenants/projects without explicitly creating members individually
through the glance API V2. Community images will not appear iu
user's default image listings

Change-Id: Ic02bf44cca5d6d793d68a8737d3cfe3f44407d88
Closes-Bug: #1626837

commit_message:
Revert "Use uwsgi for glance-api"

This reverts commit 1fa653635781cd975a1031e212b35b6c38196ba4.

This is causing a high failure rate in the gate for volume
upload tests, 75 hits in the last 3 days since the change was
merged.

Change-Id: I43e7fa88b27b9233f0a85a81e40ebcaec7134d43
Related-Bug: #1700881
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/43/479243/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo "ProxyPass \"${url}\" \"unix:${socket}|uwsgi://uwsgi-uds-${name}/\" retry=0 " | sudo tee $apache_conf
deleted_lines: echo "SetEnv proxy-sendcl 1" | sudo tee $apache_conf echo "ProxyPass \"${url}\" \"unix:${socket}|uwsgi://uwsgi-uds-${name}/\" retry=0 " | sudo tee -a $apache_conf# For services using chunked encoding, the only services known to use this # currently are Glance and Swift, we need to use an http proxy instead of # mod_proxy_uwsgi because the chunked encoding gets dropped. See: # https://github.com/unbit/uwsgi/issues/1540 You can workaround this on python2 # but that involves having apache buffer the request before sending it to # uswgi. function write_local_uwsgi_http_config { local file=$1 local wsgi=$2 local url=$3 name=$(basename $wsgi) # create a home for the sockets; note don't use /tmp -- apache has # a private view of it on some platforms. # always cleanup given that we are using iniset here rm -rf $file iniset "$file" uwsgi wsgi-file "$wsgi" port=$(get_random_port) iniset "$file" uwsgi http "127.0.0.1:$port" iniset "$file" uwsgi processes $API_WORKERS # This is running standalone iniset "$file" uwsgi master true # Set die-on-term & exit-on-reload so that uwsgi shuts down iniset "$file" uwsgi die-on-term true iniset "$file" uwsgi exit-on-reload true iniset "$file" uwsgi enable-threads true iniset "$file" uwsgi plugins python # uwsgi recommends this to prevent thundering herd on accept. iniset "$file" uwsgi thunder-lock true # Override the default size for headers from the 4k default. iniset "$file" uwsgi buffer-size 65535 # Make sure the client doesn't try to re-use the connection. iniset "$file" uwsgi add-header "Connection: close" # This ensures that file descriptors aren't shared between processes. iniset "$file" uwsgi lazy-apps true iniset "$file" uwsgi chmod-socket 666 iniset "$file" uwsgi http-raw-body true iniset "$file" uwsgi http-chunked-input true iniset "$file" uwsgi http-auto-chunked true enable_apache_mod proxy enable_apache_mod proxy_http local apache_conf="" apache_conf=$(apache_site_config_for $name) echo "KeepAlive Off" | sudo tee $apache_conf echo "ProxyPass \"${url}\" \"http://127.0.0.1:$port\" retry=0 " | sudo tee -a $apache_conf enable_apache_site $name restart_apache_server }

commit_message:
When running in gate environment, don't start services

When running in the gate environment, there's no need to start
services. Also, it is harder to dertermine whether the services are
wsgi'ed or not and that has been causing intermittent gate failures.

Change-Id: Ibe6a96a9319becf2053d26180fb7e6835a4e3a97

commit_message:
Add new ovo field type class

This patch adds new field type ListOfDictOfMiscValues which
can be used to represent list of dicts in OVO objects.

Change-Id: I809f9314f8ea9adce98758b600169a675a06c9ba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/12/476712/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @obj_base.VersionedObjectRegistry.register_if(False) class FakeNeutronObjectListOfDictOfMiscValues(base.NeutronDbObject): # Version 1.0: Initial version VERSION = '1.0' db_model = FakeModel fields = { 'id': common_types.UUIDField(), 'list_of_dicts_field': common_types.ListOfDictOfMiscValuesField(), } def get_random_dicts_list(): return [get_random_dict() for _ in range(5)] common_types.ListOfDictOfMiscValuesField: get_random_dicts_list,class BaseObjectIfaceListDictMiscValuesTestCase(_BaseObjectTestCase, test_base.BaseTestCase): _test_class = FakeNeutronObjectListOfDictOfMiscValues def test_list_of_dict_of_misc_values(self): obj_id = uuidutils.generate_uuid() float_value = 1.23 misc_list = [True, float_value] obj_dict = { 'bool': True, 'float': float_value, 'misc_list': misc_list } obj = self._test_class( self.context, id=obj_id, list_of_dicts_field=[obj_dict]) self.assertEqual(1, len(obj.list_of_dicts_field)) self.assertTrue(obj.list_of_dicts_field[0]['bool']) self.assertEqual(float_value, obj.list_of_dicts_field[0]['float']) self.assertEqual(misc_list, obj.list_of_dicts_field[0]['misc_list'])

commit_message:
Don't store attributes if resource not stored

If stack-show is called at an inopportune moment, we can attempt to store
the attributes of a resource that isn't actually in the database. This
causes occasional gate failures due to an assert.

Change-Id: Id3597845fd37bc50ae2c16089e0e63f3d1bc9a0d
Related-Bug: #1660831

subject: Revert "Call undercloud install function directly"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-29 20:59:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/13b875f5b6f0fcc30df91c59966441990c203c8c', 'message': 'Revert "Call undercloud install function directly"

This broke undercloud upgrades - tripleoclient imports instack_undercloud.undercloud, then upgrades the package.  This means the upgrade call then runs against the old version of the module, which is incompatible with some of the new puppet stuff.

Closes-Bug: 1701362

commit_message:
Revert "Call undercloud install function directly"

This broke undercloud upgrades - tripleoclient imports
instack_undercloud.undercloud, then upgrades the package.
This means the upgrade call then runs against the old version
of the module, which is incompatible with some of the new
puppet stuff.

Closes-Bug: 1701362

This reverts commit b6e71724e091a8a23191114e3638e1760240dfd2.

Change-Id: Ie79dfff667437305ff4109da5a9c42ae358b1a3e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/63/479063/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: subprocess.check_call("instack-install-undercloud") subprocess.check_call("instack-upgrade-undercloud")

commit_message:
Specify custom role data for multinode jobs

Use simplified roles data for multinode jobs. This should save the
overcloud Heat stack from having to chew YAQL for roles which wouldn't
end up being used anyway.

Depends-On: I9006cd81d748d77e310afe5f934664c603240452
Change-Id: I1dc1bdaa907d797ed4d009a5d6bf26634ba6451b

commit_message:
Convert over to use privsep module

Instead of relying on rootwrap, convert the Nova Driver code
to use the privsep module to run privileged actions. Privsep [1][2]
is the new library for managing execution of privileged command.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.privsep
[2] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/oslo-specs/specs/liberty/
    privsep.html

Change-Id: I2c77ae4426da0fdc0171dc325ca51ea5a01110a2

commit_message:
Use templated network-environment file for OVB

There are specific network-environment.yaml files for the
OVB deployments. This review removes those specific files
and adds settings so that the OVB deployments can use the
network-environment.yaml file generated from the j2 template.

Closes-Bug: #1698982
Change-Id: If4861c8fa7f847a524738f274189f6fdab4a5942

Remove wsdl_location configuration option

This option was deprecated in 15.0.0 and not even used.

Change-Id: I4b2b5e7ef3466cab129a59fedf7c339f1689b563

commit_message:
Show neutron tags in OSC network show

Now tag information of the network is displayed when the user
tries to see the network details using the command
openstack network show <net-id>

Change-Id: I587d2bca37b8dbef4400db3d8ace3c81d87e2db3
Closes-Bug: #1695783

commit_message:
Setup gate to use openstack-helm's helm-toolkit

Clones openstack-helm to retreive helm-toolkit instead of
maintaining a separate helm-toolkit in addons.  This will be
removed once zuul-cloner is leveraged in the addons gate

Change-Id: I7b70709590f547118d2319341300431946a6eaf5

commit_message:
Move Calico Felix upstream to defaults

Based on discussion in the Ocata backport of
I9c3cb1a11319f692113badf4d49bc8903effcbd7, these vars are being moved
to the defaults so they can be more easily overridden.

This will be combined into the backport patch for consistency.

Change-Id: I42a68601b3e3c6035080650caaf30ce9bc2bf712

commit_message:
Use listen instead of chained notifiers

From Ansible 2.2 onwards, listen can be used for
handlers instead of chaining notifiers. The
handlers are then executed in the sequence
present in the handler file.

Change-Id: Ia185ab830005f311f37d4eb7dfab1ae116419e3b

subject: Ensure that services restart in a particular order
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-30 12:28:13.000000000', 'files': ['templates/glance-systemd-init.j2', 'tasks/glance_init_systemd.yml', 'handlers/main.yml', 'templates/glance-systemd-tmpfiles.j2', 'defaults/main.yml', 'vars/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_glance/commit/545e362b05264cce20b3fc025726d821a39e08c8', 'message': 'Ensure that services restart in a particular order

Currently when multiple services share a host, the
restart order is random. This is due to an unordered

commit_message:
Ensure that services restart in a particular order

Currently when multiple services share a host, the
restart order is random. This is due to an unordered
dict being used to facilitate the mapping of services
to their groups, names and other options.

This patch implements changes to the role to ensure
that services on the same host are restarted in the
correct order when the software/config changes.

Change-Id: I52fc66f861ce98cc8299c84edcfd5f18d74306b3

commit_message:
Replace assertTrue(isinstance()) with assertIsInstance()

Some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B))
or assertEqual(type(A), B). The correct way is to use
assertIsInstance(A, B) provided by test tools.

Change-Id: Ibb5e5f848c5632f7c1895c47b8c1a938f2c746c3
